info.title: API Reference for Brisbane Release
info.description: This collection provides details of the methods that were supported for the **Brisbane** release. _**Previous Versions**_ **API Reference for Amsterdam GA Release** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/40843358/2sAYdctCto](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/40843358/2sAYdctCto) **API Reference for Amsterdam Early Adopter Release** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAYJ3Dg9C](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAYJ3Dg9C) **v24.9 GA** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAY55aHu5](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAY55aHu5) **v24.9 Early Access** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXqs8i1u](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXqs8i1u) **v24.8** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXxV6APE](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXxV6APE) **v24.7** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXxV6AY2](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXxV6AY2) **v24.6** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXxV6AY5](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/36611902/2sAXxV6AY5) **v24.5** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23971061/2sAYBRFZee](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23971061/2sAYBRFZee) **v24.4** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2sA35K1fUa](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2sA35K1fUa) **v24.3** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2sA2xe4u5R](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2sA2xe4u5R) **v24.2** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2s9Yyy8JLo](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2s9Yyy8JLo) **v24.1** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2s9YsM9qgX](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2s9YsM9qgX) **v23.12:** [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2s9Ykhh4VH](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/23973797/2s9Ykhh4VH) The Saviynt Identity Cloud APIs are versioned APIs. Any updates to a version are considered non-breaking to ensure the integration do not break. Breaking changes such as an addition of a new required field will be released as a new version of the API. _**Syntax used in the API URLs:**_ `{{url}}/ECM/api/v5/apiName` _**Set the variables to match your Saviynt Identity Cloud environment**_ - `{{url}}`: Enter the Saviynt Identity Cloud application URL in the following format: [https://SUBDOMAIN.saviyntcloud.com](https://SUBDOMAIN.saviyntcloud.com) For example: [https://myorg.saviyntcloud.com](https://myorg.saviyntcloud.com) - `api/v5`: Enter `api/v5`. - `{path2}}`: Enter `api/certifications/v2/items`. _**Note:**_ - If Content-Type in the response header needs to be overriden, add an entry in configuration table in database with name as 'api.v5.response.contenttype' and configdata as any valid content-type (application/json, application/xml etc.) - The Web Application Firewall (WAF) limit for Saviynt Identity Cloud is 5000/IP/5minutes. This limit ensures that the network traffic communicating with Saviynt Identity Cloud is legitimate, and enhances security.

post.description:
The `Bearer Authentication scheme` is dedicated to token authentication and is described by [RFC6750](https://). Even if this scheme comes from an OAuth2 specification, you can still use it to exchange tokens between a client and a server.

The API requires the HTTP authentication scheme `Bearer` for authentication. All requests must have a valid `Token` specified in the HTTP Authorization header with the `Bearer` scheme.

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `username`: Specify the user name to log in to Saviynt Identity Cloud.
    
- `password`: Specify the password to log in to Saviynt Identity Cloud.
    

A POST request, in which the `username` and `password` are passed in JSON text in the body, will return a `Token` in the response, which can be passed in a header variable for subsequent requests.

**Note**: You can now use the Basic Auth (basic authentication) method to authenticate the Login API (**/api/login**). To do so, select **Basic Auth** from the **Type** drop-down list on the **Authorization** tab and enter your login credentials in the **Username** and **Password** fields.

**Refresh Token Properties**

You can manage the following refresh token properties from the **externalconfig.properties** file on the **Configuration Files** page (**Admin > Settings > Configuration Files**).

| Property | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `grails.plugin.springsecurity.rest.token.storage.jwt.expiration` | Specify the time after which the access token expires. |
| `grails.plugin.springsecurity.rest.refreshtoken.storage.jwt.expiration` | Specify the time after which the refresh token expires. The refresh token expires after the specified interval and can no longer be used to get a new access token. |
| `grails.plugin.springsecurity.rest.refreshtoken.new` | Specify `true` to generate a new token after the refresh token expires. |

For more information about updating the **externalconfig.properties** file, see [Managing Configuration Files](https://docs.saviyntcloud.com/bundle/EIC-Admin-25/page/Content/Chapter06-EIC-Configurations/Managing-Configuration-Files.htm) in the _Enterprise Identity Cloud Administration Guide_.

The Saviynt Identity Cloud supports OAuth2.0, the industry-standard authorization protocol. It focuses on client developer simplicity while providing specific authorization flows for web applications. For more information, see [OAuth 2.0 documentation](https://oauth.net/2/).

**Note**_**:**_ Refresh tokens are long-lived tokens. However, they can be invalidated at any time, and your application must be designed to handle a refresh token invalidation gracefully. This can be done by obtaining a new access or refresh token using your login credentials, either interactively with user input or programmatically without explicit user action.

tags: Exchange the Authorization Code for Subject Token
post.summary: Exchange the Authorization Code for Subject Token
post.description:
After you have acquired an authorization code, you can exchange it for a subject token (access or ID tokens).

**Note**: You must configure your external Identity Provider (IdP), integrate your OIDC application with Saviynt Identity Cloud, and generate the OpenID authorization code. For more information, see [Configuring OAuth 2.0 Token Exchange Authentication](https://docs.saviyntcloud.com/bundle/EIC-Admin-25/page/Content/Chapter06-EIC-Configurations/OAuth-Token-Exchange.htm) in the _Enterprise Identity Cloud Administration Guide_.

**Mandatory URL Parameter**

**domainURL**: Specify the OpenID Connect IdP's authorization endpoint URL.

Example: [https://companyname.okta.com/oauth2/v1/token](https://companyname.okta.com/oauth2/v1/token)

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `grant_type`: Specify `authorization_code` as the grant type for the authorization code flow.
    
- `redirect_uri`: Specify the URI that was used to obtain the authorization code.
    
- `code`: Specify the authorization code you obtained.
    
- `client_id`: Specify the client ID that was generated for your registered application in the IdP.
    
- `client_secret`: Specify the client secret that was generated for your registered application in the IdP.

tags: Exchange the Subject Token for Saviynt Identity Cloud Token
post.summary: Exchange the Subject Token for Saviynt Identity Cloud Token
post.description:
After acquiring the access or ID token described in [Exchange the Authorization Code for Subject Token](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/43313744/2sB3BGJVua#652b44f7-5f6e-4549-86a8-7c6f9663d9fc), you can exchange them with the Saviynt Identity Cloud tokens to authenticate and authorize users for Saviynt APIs.

**Note**: You must configure your external Identity Provider (IdP), integrate your OIDC application with Saviynt Identity Cloud, and generate the OpenID authorization code. For more information, see [Configuring OAuth 2.0 Token Exchange Authentication](https://docs.saviyntcloud.com/bundle/EIC-Admin-25/page/Content/Chapter06-EIC-Configurations/OAuth-Token-Exchange.htm) in the _Enterprise Identity Cloud Administration Guide_.

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `grant_type`: Specify `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange` as the grant type to request the access token.
    
- `subject_token`: Specify the access or ID token from the Authorization Code flow you obtained in [Exchange the Authorization Code for Subject Token](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/43313744/2sB3BGJVua#652b44f7-5f6e-4549-86a8-7c6f9663d9fc).
    
- `subject_token_type`: The type of subject token issued by the IdP in [Exchange the Authorization Code for Subject Token](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/43313744/2sB3BGJVua#652b44f7-5f6e-4549-86a8-7c6f9663d9fc). Specify one of the following token types:
    
    - **urn:ietf:params:oauth:token-type:access_token**: Indicates that the token is an OAuth 2.0 access token.
        
    - **urn:ietf:params:oauth:token-type:id_token**: Indicates that the token is an ID token.  
        For example, if you specify an access token for the `subject_token` parameter, enter **urn:ietf:params:oauth:token-type:access_token** as the subject token type.
        
- `scope`: Specify the Oauth_token_exchange connector you created while integrating your OIDC application with Saviynt Identity Cloud.

Use this API to onboard or create a new user.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

`checkrules` - true/ false (default : true), if true, then rules will be evaluated immediately, if false rules will be evaluated by a job. If checkrulesforapi configuration(true/false/null) is set in the configuration table, then it will take precendence over checkrules parameter.

This method updates a specific "user" record in Saviynt Identity Cloud, based on the input parameter `username` of the relevant user.

All the input parameters it requires are attributes which could be updated for the relevant user record. The attributes which are supplied with valid values as input to the method, will get updated, if the operation is successfully executed.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`username`

_**OR**_

`propertytosearch`

_**Note**_ - If both params are passed, propertytosearch will take precedence.

Optional params:

`validateagainstpolicy` - Values: Y/N, default is Y. Checks for the password policy,

`allowpastdate` - true / false (default). If true, allows startdate to be less than current date,

`statuskey` - Values:1/0, 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active,

`checkrules` - true/ false (default : true), if true, then rules will be evaluated immediately, if false rules will be evaluated by a job. If checkrulesforapi configuration(true/false/null) is set in the configuration table, then it will take precendence over checkrules parameter.

`inlineruleevaluation` - true/ false (default is true), if true then rules will be evaluated immediately, if false rules will be evaluated by a job.

_**Note**_ - UpdateUser API will not invoke workflow based on the _**User Modification Workflow**_ configuration. Please use updateUserRequest API instead.

_**Note**_ - Both `checkrules` and `inlineruleevaluation` need to be set as true for the user update rules to be evaluated immediately.

_**Note**_ - This API supports PUT HTTP method along with POST.

_**It's highly recommended to pass inlineruleevaluation:"false" for bulk load and call processrules api to evaluate and run the rules after the load is done.**_

This API is used to create and update users using bulk upload.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`file` - Provide the CSV file and select the key field type as File.

Optional params:

`delimiter` - tab, pipe, comma. Default value is comma.

`zeroDayProvisioning` - YES/NO. Default value is NO.

`generateSystemUsername` - YES/NO. Default value is NO.

`generateEmail` - YES/NO. Default value is NO.

`checkrules` - YES/NO. Default value is NO.

`checkruleforcustomjar`\- YES/NO. Default value is NO. This option helps in checking whether a pre-validation is required while uploading users, on the basis of the logic defined in the Saviynt validation framework extension (JAR) file.

`expirepasswordfornewuser`\- YES/NO. Default value is NO.

`userReconcillationField` - Text field.

`userpreprocessorconfigjson` - Text field.

This API will process unprocessed data and will be evaulated as per the user update rules defined.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Optional params:

`jobidstoprocess` - parent jobid from userrulerundata table

`runzerodayrules` - Can be true/false(Default - false)

`totaljobstorun` - Total number of jobs to run (Default - 2)

`fetchroles` - Can be true/false

`batchidentifier` - Unique identifier that is defined at the time of createUser/updateUser API call.

Use this API to return a list of all users in Saviynt Identity Cloud.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Optional Parameters**

- `username` - Specify the username for which you want to get the user attribute details.
    
- `responsefields` - User attributes which you want to see in the response(for encrypted values, mention ecp<1-5>, and for hashed values, mention hcp<1-5>).
    
- `max`: Specify the maximum number of results that can be returned in the response. The maximum number that you can specify is `500`.
    
- `offset`: Specify the the starting point (index) from which to start retrieval. The minimum value that you can specify is `1` .
    
- `sort`: Specify the order in which results are returned in the response. If no order is specified then default value is `username`.
    
- `order`: The order in which the sorting is performed. For example `asc` (default) or `desc` order.
    
- `manager`: Specify the username of the manager.
    
- `secondarymanager`: Specify the userkey or username of the user's secondary manager.
    
- `showsecurityanswers` - "0"/"1" to display encrypted security answers for the user
    
- `filtercriteria` - User fields based on which you want to get the user attribute details(including userkey),
    
- `searchCriteria` - search for a user based on the string passed (eg - “\*ab\*” or “\*ab” or “ab\*”) in their firstname, lastname, displayname and username only, example - "ab\*" - This will return all users with firstname or lastname or username starting with "ab"
    
- `advsearchcriteria` : Search for a user based on the string passed (eg - “\*ab\*” or “\*ab” or “ab\*”), example - {"username":"a\*", "firstname":"\*b"} - This will return all users with username starting with "a" AND firstname ending with "b". Exact match search is applicable for types boolean, users, customer. Date can be entered in format - yyyy-MM-dd.
    
- `userQuery`: Specify the user query. For example: `“userQuery”:”user.customproperty1='abc' or user.displayname like '%display%'”`
    

_**Note**_ - By default, if no responsefields param is passed, required attrs that will always return are username, email, statuskey, firstname, lastname, employeeid along with other attributes with nonblank values only.

get.description:
This API returns the user information from SSM. This API will return only the user attributes which are not null or blank.

You can search for a user based on any parameters given below and not only the username.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Mandatory params:
`q`

Optional params:
`offset`,
`max`,
`sort`,
`order`,
`countonly`,
`fields`
`showsecurityanswers` - "0"/"1" to display encrypted security answers for the user

post.description:
This method grants/removes membership of a "user" to one or more roles in SSM.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Mandatory params: 

`username` - Username for the user to whom the roles are to be granted,

`rolename` - comma separated values with names of roles that need to be granted,

`operation` (0/1) - 0:Remove and 1:Add

This API call can be used to get the user details, account details, and details of all the entitlements the user has access to. 

This API will return only the entitlement attributes which are not null or not empty.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Mandatory params:
`username`

Optional params:
`endpoint`, `max`, `offset`, `entitlementtype`

***Note*** - This API supports GET HTTP method along with POST.

tags: Get Flat Response Entitlement Details For User
get.summary: Get Flat Response Entitlement Details For User
get.description:
This API call can be used to get a flat response consisting of user details, account details, and details of all the entitlements the user has access to. 

This API will return only the entitlement attributes which are not null or not empty.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Optional params:
`username`, `entitlementType`, `entitlement_value`, `endpoint`, `userQuery`, `accountQuery`, `entQuery`, `accEntQuery`, `max`(default - 100), `offset`(default - 0)

tags: Get Flat Response Role Details For User
get.summary: Get Flat Response Role Details For User
get.description:
This API call can be used to get a flat response consisting of user details and details of all the roles the user has access to. 

This API will return only the entitlement attributes which are not null or not empty.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Optional params:
`rolename`, `roletype`, `username`, `userQuery`, `roleQuery`, `roleUserAccQuery`, `max`(default - 100), `offset`(default - 0)

post.description:
Use this API to authenticate the user in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `username`
    
- `password`

This API will validate the attribute values of an existing user.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`username`

Optional params:

user properties like `customproperty<1-50>`, `hcp<1-5>`, `ecp<1-5>`, `firstname`, `lastname`, `statuskey`, `manager` etc.

get.description:
Use this API to return the SAV roles of an user in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Optional params:

`max`,`offset`,`username`

delete.description:
This API can remove images from both EIC and server directory.

TYPE - DELETE  
BODY - n/a

By default, users associated to ROLE_ADMIN or ROLE_ADMIN_SAVIYNTSUPPORT SAV roles can delete images from EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`UserName`

post.description:
This method returns a `List` of "Accounts" in SSM.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Optional params:  
`username`,  
`endpoint`,  
`max`,  
`offset`,  
`accountQuery`,  
`advsearchcriteria` - accountKey,description,comments,accounttype,status,customproperty1-customproperty56,accountID,displayName,name,creator (username),updateuser (username),validfromDate validthrough,createdon,lastlogondate,lastpasswordchange,updatedate,orphan (true/false),  
accountowner - with fields 1. type - user/ usergroup (mandatory), 2. value - username/ usergroup name (mandatory), 3. rank - 1 to 5 (optional)

Sample - "advsearchcriteria":{ "status":"ACTIVE","name":"john\*","createdon":"2016-12-13","customproperty12":"\*Ro\*","orphan":"true","accountowner": \[  
{  
"type": "user",  
"value": "janedoe",  
"rank": "1"  
}  
\]},

Date can be searched with 'yyyy-MM-dd', dates and boolean are exact match.

**Note**: Any OR conditions must be used within parenthesis. For example:

{  
"accountQuery":"(acc.status='1' or acc.comments like '%a%')",  
"username":"admin"  
}

This API call can be used to fetch all the existing accounts in a particular endpoint and security system along with the account attributes.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Mandatory params:
`endpoint` - not the display name,
`securitysystem` - not the display name

This method creates a new "account" for an "endpoint" in SSM. All the input parameters it requires are attributes with which the new account record would get created.

The `Authorization` header variable must be set to `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`securitysystem` - not display name,  
`endpoint` - not display name,  
`name` - account name to be created

Optional params:

`accountid`,  
`username` - user for whom the account is created,  
`requestor` - user who is creating the account,

`accountowner` - owner of account

1.`type`\- usergroup / user, mandatory field  
2\. `value` - usergroup name / username, mandatory field  
3\. `rank` - values from 1-5, optional filed, Default: 1,

`description`,  
`displayname`,  
`comments`,  
`accountid`,  
`customproperty<1-56>`,  
`passwordchangestatus`,  
`privileged`,  
`usergroup`,  
`status` - Manually Suspended/Manually Provisioned/SUSPENDED FROM IMPORT SERVICE/1/2/3/4, default: 1  
`accounttype` - Service Account/Shared Account/FIREFIGHTERID, defaul: null,  
`incorrectlogons`,  
`orphan` - true/false,  
`validfrom` - MM-dd-yyyy,  
`validthrough` - MM-dd-yyyy,  
`lastlogondate` - MM-dd-yyyy,  
`passwordlockdate`\- MM-dd-yyyy,  
`lastpasswordchange` - MM-dd-yyyy

This method updates a particular "account" record in Saviynt, based on the account name.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:  
`securitysystem`,  
`endpoint`,  
`name` - account name

Optional params:  
`customproperty<1 to 30>`,  
`status`,  
`description`

`accountowner`

- `type`: Specify user or usergroup as the owner type. This is a mandatory parameter.
- `value`: Specify usergroup name or username. This is a mandatory parameter.
- `rank`: Specify the rank of the owner. You can specify values from 1 to 5, 26, or 27. Specify 26 for a primary certifier and 27 for any secondary certifier. This is an optional parameter, and the default value is 1.
- `action`: Specify add or remove. This is a mandatory parameter.
    

`description`,  
`displayname`,  
`comments`,  
`accountid`,  
`customproperty<1-56>`,  
`passwordchangestatus`,  
`privileged`,  
`usergroup`,

`updateuser` - username of user who is updating the account,  
`status` - Manually Suspended/Manually Provisioned/SUSPENDED FROM IMPORT SERVICE/1/2/3/4, default: 1  
`accounttype` - The account type that is imported from the third-party application (for example, Service Account, Shared Account, FIREFIGHTERID, and so on). default: null  
`incorrectlogons`,  
`orphan` - true/false,  
`validfrom` - MM-dd-yyyy,  
`validthrough` - MM-dd-yyyy,  
`lastlogondate` - MM-dd-yyyy,  
`passwordlockdate`\- MM-dd-yyyy,  
`lastpasswordchange` - MM-dd-yyyy

This method provisions an "Account" to a "User" in SSM.  The "Account" corresponds to a particular IT Application (e.g Microsoft Active Directory) which is modeled in SSM as "Endpoint" of a "Security System". 

Mandatory params:

`securitysystem` - Name of the Security System for the relevant IT Application modeled in SSM.

`endpoint`- Name of the Endpoint corresponding to the Security System.

`accountname` - Account name for the provisioned account.

`username` - Username of the user to whom the account has to be provisioned.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

This method provisions one or more "Entitlements" to an "Account". The "Entitlements" and "Account" correspond to a particular IT Application (e.g Microsoft Active Directory) which is modeled in SSM as "Endpoint" of a "Security System".

Mandatory params:  
`securitysystem` - Name of the Security System for the relevant IT Application modeled in SSM.

`endpoint`\- Name of the Endpoint corresponding to the Security System.

`accountname` - Account name to which the entitlements should be provisioned.

`entitlementtype` - Entitlement type for the entitlements which are to be provisioned. e.g. AD Groups, EBS Responsibilities, SAP Roles etc.

`entitlementvalue` - Names of the actual entitlements which are to be provisioned.

`startdate`: Specify the start date for the access period in MM-DD-YYYY date format (example: `12-23-2022`).

  
  

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

This method deprovisions one or more "Entitlements" from an "Account". The "Entitlements" and "Account" correspond to a particular IT Application (e.g Microsoft Active Directory) which is modeled in SSM as "Endpoint" of a "Security System".

Mandatory params: 

`securitysystem` - Name of the Security System for the relevant IT Application modeled in SSM.

`endpoint`- Name of the Endpoint corresponding to the Security System.

`accountname` - Account name from which the entitlements should be deprovisioned.

`entitlementtype` - Entitlement type for the entitlements which are to be deprovisioned. e.g. AD Groups, EBS Responsibilities, SAP Roles etc.

`entitlementvalue` - Names of the actual entitlements which are to be deprovisioned.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

post.description:
This API call can be used to get the list and details of all the entitlements the user has access to.

This API will return only the entitlement attributes which are not null or not empty.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Optional params:  
`username`,  
`entitlementtype`,  
`endpoint`,  
`requestedObject` -"users","userscount",  
`max`,  
`offset`,  
`entitlementResponseFields`,  
`userResponseFields`,  
`userfiltercriteria`,  
`accountname`,  
`entownerwithrank` - if "true", returns the list of owners with owner rank for every entitlementValue,  
`returnentitlementmap`(true/false,default:false) - If true, entitlementmap details will be returned,  
`exactmatch` - Default is true. If given as false, it will search based on similar matches,

`entitlementfiltercriteria`,

OR

`entQuery` - query to support only entitlement_values parameters. Sample - "ent.description = 'Desc' or ent.displayname like '%display%'".

_**Note**_ - Either pass param entitlementfiltercriteria (with or without exactmatch) OR entQuery. Both cannot be passed simultaneously.

get.description:
This API can be used to get the list of all child entitlements.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`endpointname`/`endpointkey` - if both are passed endpointkey is considered

Optional params:

`entitlementtypekey`/`entitlementtypename` - Possible values should have parent entitlementtypekey/entitlementtypename. If both are passed entitlementtypekey is considered,

`parententitlementvalue`/`parententitlementvaluekey` - if both are passed parententitlementvaluekey is considered,

`entquery` - query to support parent entitlement_values parameters. Sample - "pev.status = 1",

`childentquery` - query to support child entitlement_values parameters. Sample - "cev.customproperty3 = '25'",

`entitlements2query` - query to support entitlements2 parameters. Sample - "e2.jobId is not null",

`responsefields` - possible values should have child entitlementvalue domain properties. Sample - \["description","customproperty1","customproperty3","displayname"\],

`max`,

`offset`

This method creates a new "entitlementvalue" for an "endpoint" in SSM. All the input parameters it requires are attributes with which the new account record would get created.

Ensure: The `Authorization` header variable must be set to `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`endpoint`,
`entitlementtype`,
`entitlement_value`

Optional params:

`attributes` for Entitlement_values,

`entitlementowner<N>` - N is the rank, `entitlementowner` modifies entitlementowner with rank 1, `entitlementowner3` - modifies entitlementowner with rank 3,

`entitlementID`,`newentitlement_value` - used to update the entitlement if multiple entitlements with same entitlement_value are present under the same entitlementtype and endpoint

`entitlementcasecheck`(can be true or false, default : false) - If true, entitlement value search will be case sensitive during create or update.

`entitlement_valuekey`

`updatedentitlement_value` - new value for entitlement_value

`entitlementmap` - 
1. `entitlementvalue`
2. `entitlementtype`
3. `endpoint`
4. `requestfilter`
5. `excludeentitlement`
6. `adddependenttask`
7. `removedependententtask`
8. `updateType`(ADD/REMOVE, default : ADD)

Use this API to create an endpoint in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `endpointname`: Specify a name for the endpoint. Provide a logical name that will help you easily identify it.
    
- `displayName`: Enter a user-friendly display name for the endpoint that will be displayed in the user interface. Display Name can be different from Endpoint Name.
    
- `securitysystem`: Specify the Security system for which you want to create an endpoint.
    

**Optional Parameters**

- `description`**:** Specify a description for the endpoint.
    
- `ownerType`: Specify the owner type for the endpoint. An endpoint can be owned by a `User` or `Usergroup`.
    
- `owner`: Specify the owner of the endpoint. If the `ownerType` is `User`, then specify the username of the owner, and If it is is `Usergroup` then specify the name of the user group.
    
- `resourceOwnerType`: Specify the resource owner type for the endpoint. An endpoint can be owned by a `User` or `Usergroup`.
    
- `resourceOwner`: Specify the resource owner of the endpoint. If the `resourceOwnerType` is `User`, then specify the username of the owner and If it is `Usergroup`, specify the name of the user group.
    
- `accessquery`: Specify the query to filter the access and display of the endpoint to specific users. If you do not define a query, the endpoint is displayed for all users.
    
- `enableCopyAccess`: Specify `true` to display the **Copy Access from User** option in the Request pages.
    
- `createEntTaskforRemoveAccEnd`: If this is set to `true`, remove Access tasks will be created for entitlements (account entitlements and their dependent entitlements) when a user requests for removing an account.
    
- `disableNewAccountRequestIfAccountExists`: Specify `true` to disable users from requesting additional accounts on applications where they already have active accounts.
    
- `disableRemoveAccount`: Specify `true` to disable users from removing their existing application accounts.
    
- `disableModifyAccount`: Specify `true` to disable users from modifying their application accounts.
    
- `blockInflightRequest`: Specify `true` to prevent users from raising duplicate requests for the same applications.
    
- `accountNameRule`: Specify rule to generate an account name for this endpoint while creating a new account.
    
- `userAccountCorrelationRule`: Specify rule to map users in EIC with the accounts during account import.
    
- `connectionconfig`: Use this configuration for processing the add access tasks and remove access tasks for AD and LDAP Connectors.
    
- `customproperty1` to `customproperty45`: Custom properties 1 to 45.
    
- `customproperty1Label` to `customproperty45Label`: Specify the labels for the custom properties of accounts associated with this endpoint.
    
- `parentAccountPattern`: Specify the parent and child relationship for the Active Directory endpoint. The specified value is used to filter the parent and child objects in the **Request Access** tile.
    
- `serviceAccountAccessQuery`: Specify the query to filter the access and display of the endpoint for specific users while managing service accounts
    
- `allowRemoveAllRoleOnRequest`: Specify `true` to displays the **Remove All Roles** option in the Request page that can be used to remove all the roles.
    
- `changePasswordAccessQuery`: Specify query to restrict the access for changing the account password of the endpoint.
    
- `accountNameValidatorRegex`: Specify the regular expression which will be used to validate the account name either generated by the rule or provided manually.
    
- `statusConfig`: Specify to enable the `State` and `Status` options (Enable, Disable, Lock, Unlock) that would be available to request for a user and service accounts.
    
- `pluginConfigs`: The Plugin Configuration drives the functionality of the Saviynt SmartAssist (Browserplugin).
    
- `endpointConfig`: Specify to copy data in Step 3 of the service account request will be enabled.

example.endpointConfig: {"Copy Service Account Request Data": true,"DISABLE_SORTING" : true}

put.description:
Use this API to update an endpoint in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

Note: From Release v23.9, a new parameter **`requestableRoleType`** is introduced to update the requestable options of a Role for a particular endpoint.

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `endpointname`: Specify a name for the endpoint. Provide a logical name that will help you easily identify it.
    

**Optional Parameters**

- `displayName`: Enter a user-friendly display name for the endpoint that will be displayed in the user interface. Display Name can be different from Endpoint Name.
    
- `securitysystem`: Specify the Security system for which you want to create an endpoint.
    
- `description`**:** Specify a description for the endpoint.
    
- `ownerType`: Specify the owner type for the endpoint. An endpoint can be owned by a `User` or `Usergroup`.
    
- `owner`: Specify the owner of the endpoint. If the `ownerType` is `User`, then specify the username of the owner, and If it is is `Usergroup` then specify the name of the user group.
    
- `resourceOwnerType`: Specify the resource owner type for the endpoint. An endpoint can be owned by a `User` or `Usergroup`.
    
- `resourceOwner`: Specify the resource owner of the endpoint. If the `resourceOwnerType` is `User`, then specify the username of the owner and If it is `Usergroup`, specify the name of the user group.
    
- `accessquery`: Specify the query to filter the access and display of the endpoint to specific users. If you do not define a query, the endpoint is displayed for all users.
    
- `enableCopyAccess`: Specify `true` to display the **Copy Access from User** option in the Request pages.
    
- `createEntTaskforRemoveAccEnd`: If this is set to `true`, remove Access tasks will be created for entitlements (account entitlements and their dependent entitlements) when a user requests for removing an account.
    
- `disableNewAccountRequestIfAccountExists`: Specify `true` to disable users from requesting additional accounts on applications where they already have active accounts.
    
- `disableRemoveAccount`: Specify `true` to disable users from removing their existing application accounts.
    
- `disableModifyAccount`: Specify `true` to disable users from modifying their application accounts.
    
- `blockInflightRequest`: Specify `true` to prevent users from raising duplicate requests for the same applications.
    
- `accountNameRule`: Specify rule to generate an account name for this endpoint while creating a new account.
    
- `userAccountCorrelationRule`: Specify rule to map users in EIC with the accounts during account import.
    
- `connectionconfig`: Use this configuration for processing the add access tasks and remove access tasks for AD and LDAP Connectors.
    
- `customproperty1` to `customproperty45`: Custom properties 1 to 45.
    
- `customproperty1Label` to `customproperty45Label`: Specify the labels for the custom properties of accounts associated with this endpoint.
    
- `allowRemoveAllRoleOnRequest`: Specify `true` to displays the **Remove All Roles** option in the Request page that can be used to remove all the roles.
    
- `changePasswordAccessQuery`: Specify query to restrict the access for changing the account password of the endpoint.
    
- `accountNameValidatorRegex`: Specify the regular expression which will be used to validate the account name either generated by the rule or provided manually.
    
- `statusConfig`: Specify to enable the `State` and `Status` options (Enable, Disable, Lock, Unlock) that would be available to request for a user and service accounts.
    
- `pluginConfigs`: The Plugin Configuration drives the functionality of the Saviynt SmartAssist (Browserplugin).
    
- `endpointConfig`: Specify to copy data in Step 3 of the service account request will be enabled.
    
- `requestOption` - Supports valid case-senstive string values such as “None”, “DropDownSingle”, “Table”, and “TableOnlyAdd”
    
- `required` - Supports valid boolean values are true and false`requestedQuery/selectedQuery` Supports string values in double quotes
    
- `showOn` - Supports valid case-sensitive string values such as "All", "ShowOnApplicationRequest", and "ShowOnServiceAccountRequest". specify the value to display the roles on Application Requests, Service Account Requests, or both.
    
- `emailTemplate`: Specify an email template and associate it with a task to use it for sending emails based on the status of the task. Task types such as New Account, Add Access, Remove Account, New Account, and New Account with a password must be configured before they are associated with email templates.

Use this API to returns list of endpoints in EIC.

- `filterCriteria`

Use this API to create dynamic attributes in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `endpoint`: Specify the name of the endpoint whose associated dynamic attributes you want to fetch.
    
- `securitysystem`: Specify the name of the Security system mapped to the endpoint.
    
- `dynamicattributes`: Specify the name of the dynamic attributes you want to fetch from the endpoints.
    
- `requesttype`(ACCOUNT/PROPOSED ENTITLEMENT OWNER/ENTITLEMENT OWNER ATTESTATION/ROLE/SERVICE ACCOUNT)
    

**Optional Parameters**

- `updateuser`
    
- `dynamicattributes` - `attributename`,
    

`dynamicattributes` - other dynamic attribute parameters:

- `attributetype`: Specify the attribute type based on which you want to filter and display the dynamic attributes.The various types of attribute types are: Single select from Sql Query, ENUM, Password, Boolean (True,False), String, Check Box, Date, and so on.
    
- `attributename`: Specify the dynamic attribute name to be used for filtering out and calling the respective attribute to be displayed.
    
- `Attribute Group`: Attribute Group provides you an option to group or categorize and display the dynamic attributes in the Access Requests request form.
    
- `Order Index`: Specify the sequence where you want to display the dynamic attributes. You can specify values such as 0,1, 2, 3 and so on. Order index with lower values is displayed first and those with higher values are displayed later.
    
- `attributelable`: Specify the name of the attribute, which you want to display in the Access Requests request form. You can apply the following font styling to the label:
    
    - `##SavBoldStart##Attribute_Name##SavBoldEnd##`
        
    - `##SavUnderlineStart##Attribute_Name##SavItalicEnd##`
        
    - `##SavUnderlineStart##Attribute_Name##UnderlineEnd##`
        
    - `##SavAnchorStart####SavUrlStart##https://exampleorg.com##SavUrlEnd####SavUrlTextStart##URL_Text##SavUrlTextEnd####SavAnchorEnd##`

put.description: Use this API to update the dynamic attributes associated with an endpoint in EIC. The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. **Mandatory Parameters** - `endpoint`: Specify the name of the endpoint whose associated dynamic attributes you want to fetch. - `securitysystem`: Specify the name of the Security system mapped to the endpoint. - `dynamicattributes`: Specify the name of the dynamic attributes you want to fetch from the endpoints. **Optional Parameters** - `dynamicattributes` - other attributes of dynamic attributes - `attributetype`(BOOLEAN/NUMBER/STRING/ENUM/MULTIPLE SELECT FROM LIST/MULTIPLE SELECT FROM SQL QUERY/SINGLE SELECT FROM SQL QUERY/PASSWORD/LARGE TEXT/CHECK BOX/DATE) - `requesttype`(ACCOUNT/PROPOSED ENTITLEMENT OWNER/ENTITLEMENT OWNER ATTESTATION/ROLE/SERVICE ACCOUNT) - `attributelable`: Specify the name of the attribute, which you want to display in the Access Requests request form. You can apply following font styling to the label: - **##SavBoldStart##**_**Attribute_Name**_**##SavBoldEnd##** - **##SavItalicStart##**_**Attribute_Name**_**##SavItalicEnd##** - **##SavUnderlineStart##**_**Attribute_Name**_**##SavItalicEnd##** - **##SavUrlStart##**_**Attribute_Name**_**##SavUrlEnd##** - **##SavAnchorStart####SavUrlStart##**[https://exampleorg.com##SavUrlEnd####SavUrlTextStart##](https://)_**URL_Text**_**##SavUrlTextEnd####SavAnchorEnd##** - `hideoncreate`: Specify `true` to hide the dynamic attribute temporarily for new account request. - `hideonupdate`: Specify `true` to to hide the dynamic attribute temporarily for modify account request.

post.description:
Use this API to create a Security System in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameters**

- `systemname`: Specify a name for the security system. Provide a logical name that will help you easily identify it.
    
- `displayName`: Specify a user-friendly display name that is shown on the the user interface.
    

**Optional Parameters**

- `accessAddWorkflow`: Specify the workflow to be used for approvals for an access request, which can be for an account, entitlements, role, and so on.
    
- `accessRemoveWorkflow`: Specify the workflow to be used when access has to be revoked, which can be for an account, entitlement, or any other de-provisioning task.
    
- `addServiceAccountWorkflow`: Specify the workflow to be used for approvals for an add service account request and assigning entitlements for the respective service account.
    
- `removeServiceAccountWorkflow`: Specify the workflow to be used for removing a service account request and removing entitlements for the respective service account.
    
- `automatedProvisioning`: Specify `true` to enable automated provisioning.
    
- `useopenconnector`: Specify `true` to enable the connectivity with any system over the open-source connectors such as REST.
    
- `reconApplication`: Specify `true` to importing data from respective endpoint associated to security system.
    
- `provisioningTries`: Specify the number of times that you want a pending task to be tried for provisioning.
    
- `instantprovision`: Specify `true` to prevent users from raising duplicate requests for the same applications.
    
- `provisioningcomments`: Specify relevant comments for performing provisioning.

put.description:
Use this API to update an existing Security system in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

StartFragment

**Mandatory Parameters:**

`systemname`: Specify the security system name you want to update.

**Optional Parameters:**

- `displayName`: Specify a meaningful display name that displays in the Saviynt user interface. The display name can be different from the system name.
    
- `hostname`
    
- `port`: The port number parameter though provided is not used for the Security System.
    
- `policyRule`: Use this setting to assign the password policy for the security system.  
    **Note**: Available from Release v24.5 onwards.
    
- `policyRuleServiceAccount`: Use this setting to assign the password policy which will be used to set the service account passwords for the security system.  
    **Note**: Available from Release v24.5 onwards.
    
- `accessAddWorkflow`: Select the workflow to be used for approving access requests for an account, entitlements, role, and so on.
    
- `accessRemoveWorkflow`: Select the workflow to be used when an access must be revoked, which can be for an account, entitlement, or any other deprovisioning task.
    
- `addServiceAccountWorkflow`: Select the workflow to be used for approvals for an add service account request and assigning entitlements for the respective service account.
    
- `removeServiceAccountWorkflow`: Select the workflow to be used for removing a service account request and removing entitlements for the respective service account.
    
- `connectionparameters`
    
- `automatedProvisioning`
    
- `connectionname`: Select the connection name for performing reconciliation of identity objects from third-party application.
    
- `provisioningConnection`
    
- `serviceDeskConnection`
    
- `provisioningcomments`
    
- `action` - "enable" or "disable",
    
- `defaultSystem`
    
- `reconApplication`
    
- `provisioningTries:` Specify the number of tries to be used for performing provisioning / de-provisioning to the third-party application.  
    **Note:** From Release v23.1, you can specify `provisioningTries` between 1 to 20 based on your requirement.
    
- `inherentSODReportFields`: You can use this option used to filter out columns in SOD.  
    **Note**: Available from Release v24.5 onwards.

get.description:
Use this API to retrieve the list of Security Systems in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

**Optional Parameters**:

- `systemname`: Specify the security system name.

put.description:
Use this API to update an organization in EIC.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameters**:

- `organizationname`: Specify a unique name of the organization.
    

**Other Parameters:**

- `username`: Specify the user who is creating the organization.  
    **Note:**  
    When the setting is `api.token.usercontext=true`in the externalconfig.properties file:
    
- The `username` parameter is **optional**.
    
- The API uses the user context derived from the **authorization token**.
    

However, when the setting is `api.token.usercontext=false` in the externalconfig.properties file:  
The `username` parameter is **mandatory** in the payload.

- If the `username` is **missing**, the API returns ”username cannot be null or blank”.
    
- If the `username` is invalid, the API returns "username \[xyz\] not found."
    

**Optional Parameters**:

- `updatedorgname`
    
- `parentorganization`
    
- `primarycontact`
    
- `endpoints`:
    
    - `endpointname`
        
    - `updatetype`: `add` or `remove`
        
- `roles`
    
    - `rolename`
        
    - `updatetype`: `add` or `remove`
        
- `rules`
    
    - `name`
        
    - `type`: `BUISNESS`, `TECH`, `USERUPDATE`, `NEWUSER`, `REMOVEUSER`, `UPDATE_ENTITLEMENT`, `NEW_ENTITLEMENT`, `REMOVE_ENTITLEMENT`, or `REQUEST`.
        
    - `updatetype`: `add` or `remove`  
        **Note**: The rule values are only validated and not saved or updated. This value will be removed in the Chicago release.
        
- `entitlements`
    
    - `entitlementvalue`
        
    - `entitlementtype`
        
    - `endpoint`
        
    - `updatetype`: `add`or`remove`
        
- `owners`
    
    - `owner`
        
    - `rank   `**Note**: An error message will appear if the same POLICY already exists for both owner and rank parameters.
        
- `policy`: `SUPERADMIN`, `ADMIN`, `BULKADMIN`, `USERADMIN`, `CAMPAIGNADMIN`, or `READONLY`.  
    **Note:** The `CAMPAIGNADMIN` policy is available from Release v24.9 onwards. StartFragmentThe default policy is `SUPERADMIN`. If the same POLICY already exists, an error message will be shown.
    
- `updatetype`: `add`, `update`, or`remove`
    
- `attributes`
    
    - `attributegroupname`
        
    - `attributes`
        
    - `value`
        
    - `attributevalues`
        
    - `updatetype`: `addgroup`, or `deletegroup`, or `updategroup`.

This API is used to fetch runtime analytics data from ES.

Starting with Release v24.6, the response does not alert users if control execution exceeds 55 seconds. Instead, the control will continue processing normally and deliver results as expected.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

- `analyticsid` _**OR**_ `analyticsname`((if both are passed then analyticsid will be considered)
    
- `attributes` - runtime control parameters.
    

Note: Ensure that any runtime control parameter of type date has the following format: "YYYY-MM-DD".

Sample : For this query - SELECT u.username, u.firstname, u.lastname, u.email, u.manager AS 'USERCONTEXT',u.statuskey FROM users u WHERE u.statuskey is not null and u.statuskey not in (${statuskey}) and u.MANAGER is not null;  
"attributes":{  
"statuskey": "0"  
}

Optional params:  
`max`,  
`offset`,  
`requestor`

**\[Updated on 22 October, 2025\]**

Starting from 24.9 GA

- Request : `Return Latest Analytics History` - Returns the most recent analytics history generated at the time of the API request.
    

Concurrent Analytics Requests:

When two requests are made simultaneously to run the same analytics, each request processes the analytics independently. The API will return the historical data each request generates in its response.

If the `history to keep` setting is set to 1 or is less than the number of concurrent requests, older history may be deleted during simultaneous execution. In this case, the API will respond with the following message: `Due to a concurrent request, the history for this session was deleted. Please call the API again to retrieve the latest history.`

Note: To avoid conflicts, it is advisable to invoke API requests sequentially, waiting for the response of each call before making the subsequent request.

- Response: `analyticsHistoryKey`  
    \- This parameter is sent in the response corresponding to the Return Latest Analytics History data is sent.
    

Each API response now includes an analyticsHistoryKey.When included in subsequent requests, the API retrieves data from the same history instance rather than re-running analytics. Ensure data consistency, especially for paginated results.

It is recommended to use the POST method.

`loggedinuser`

_**Note**_: Security is based on owner, delegate, ROLE_ADMIN, SAV_ROLE's analytics ES category.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

This web service API fetches the details of analytics controls ES, including the Offset value in the response. It supports the usage of GET and POST methods.

The POST method is recommended.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Response Fields:

- **UpdateDate** refers to the date and time when each individual record in the Analytics run history was last updated.
    
- **Comments:** The system displays all new and existing comments, appending them one after another when an analytics record is reopened manually or after the end date is reached.
    

Mandatory params:  
`analyticsname`/`analyticsid`

Optional params:

- `filtercriteria` :  
    Sample:
    

``` json
{
  "status": [
    "Accept"
  ],
  "username": [
    "acook",
    "crichards"
  ]
}

 ```

- `max` - limit = 500, default max is also 500.
    
- `offset`
    
- `loggedinuser`
    

_**Note**_: Security is based on owner, delegate, ROLE_ADMIN, SAV_ROLE's analytics ES category.  
"status" cannot be keyword in the query, modification of the work can be used like "userstatus".

This API can return the response even if the `offset` parameter is set beyond 1000.

Now, the response of this API displays an additional offset attribute.

Starting with Release v24.1, the behavior of this API has been modified as follows:

- **For newly created analytics controls:** You can swiftly execute and retrieve the history of newly created analytics controls.
    
- **For previously existing analytics controls:** To expedite fetching the run history of previously existing analytics controls, you must initially run the control on the Analytics Configuration List page within the user interface. Subsequently, you can use the API to fetch the run history.

`file` (In Postman, select form-data for body type. Pass "file" in key, select the type as File, and upload the file in the value).

_**Note**_: File type needs to be configured as allowed file type in Saviynt.

_**Note**_: Starting with Release v24.3, EIC performs a virus scan of the selected file prior to upload to ensure it is free from any threats. If a virus is detected during the scanning process and the uploaded file is found to be infected, an error message is displayed.

This API call can be used to fetch the request history of all the requests submitted by an user.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`username` - Requestor's username

Optional params:

`status` - OPEN/DRAFT/INPROCESS/COMPLETED/EXPIRED/DISCONTINUED. For example: as a list \["open","expired"\] or a single status like "open",

`requestkey`,  
`requestedfor`,  
`requestedby`,

`sort` - requestsubmittedon/duedate/requestid,

`order` - asc or desc,

`requestid`,  
`duedatestart`(MM/dd/yyyy),  
`duedateend`(MM/dd/yyyy),  
`submitdatestart`(MM/dd/yyyy),  
`submitdateend`(MM/dd/yyyy),  
`endpoint`,  
`securitysystem`,

`firstname` (requestedfor user),

`lastname` (requestedfor user),

`assignee` - list of usernames,

`requesttype` - list of requesttypes, (ADD,UPDATEACCOUNT,NEWACCOUNT,DEL,NEWROLEREQUEST,CREATEROLE,MODIFYROLE,CREATEUSER,UPDATEUSER,EXTENDACCESS etc),

`approvedby` - list of usernames,

`rejectedby` - list of usernames,

`max`, `offset`,

`showentitlementdetails` - true/false,

`entresponsefields` - if `showentitlementdetails` is true, sample - "entresponsefields":\["description","soxcritical","customproperty1","syscritical","risk","privileged","status","confidentiality"\]

`exactmatch`(true/false) - If true, returns records for which value of requestedfor, firstname, lastname fields matches exactly.

`requestandteaskstatus` : Empty/ Request completed, Task pending/ Request Completed, Task Completed, EIC fetches the Request and task status.  
**Note:**  
**Task Completed** indicates that all tasks have reached an end state, either **Completed**, **Failed**, or **Discontinued**.  
**Task Pending i**ndicates that atleast one of the tasks is pending provisioning.

`statusAsNewUI` : true (default) /false. If true, EIC fetches the request Status as per the New User Experience, else EIC fetches the Status as per the Modern Experience.  
**Note:** Available from the Amsterdam Early Adopter release.

This API is used to approve/reject requests. Before running this call, first we need to run the API to retrieve request approval details in order to obtain the taskid and taskkey.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:  
`requestKey`,  
`approver`,  
`approvaldata` (taskid, taskkey, action, requestAccessComments); action:1/2, 1 - approve, 2 - reject

`requestAccessComments`: Specify comments for access approval or rejection. Users must include access comments when the **Require Approval Comments** or **Require Rejection Comments** settings are enabled under **Admin > Global Configurations > Requests.** If users do not provide `requestAccessComments` the request approvals fail with the "**requestAccessComments cannot be null or blank**" reason.

Optional params:  
`comments`

_**Note**_: enableapprovervalidationinapprovalapi flag(with true/false values) can be added in configuration table to enable/disable validations when approver approvers the request.Default value of enableapprovervalidationinapprovalapi flag is null.

The `approve` API handles various types of approval processes, including user, account, entitlement, and role approvals. The API supports both individual and bulk actions with validations to ensure accurate data submission. User-friendly error messages are provided for any validation issues.

### Common Request Body Fields

- `certkey`: (Mandatory string) Certification key
    
- `cert_userkey`: (Mandatory string) User key
    
- `cert_entitlement_valuekey`: (Mandatory string) Key to define user, role, and account. The following are the values:
    
    - User = "-4"
        
    - Role = "-2"
        
    - Account = "0"
        
    - Entitlement = "any value"
        
- `cert_accountkey`: (string) Account key (if applicable)
    
- `cert_rolekey`: (string) Role key (if applicable)
    
- `status`: (string) Approval status. The following are the values to be used:
    
    - Revoke / Action Cancelled = "0"
        
    - Approve and Change End Date = "2"
        
    - Reject = "3"
        
    - Terminate = "4"
        
    - Change End Date for Acc/Ent/Role = "5"
        
- `comments`: (string) Any comments related to the approval

The `Reject` API handles rejection actions for users, accounts, entitlements, and roles. The API supports both individual and bulk rejection actions and includes validations to ensure accurate data submission. It provides user-friendly error messages in case of validation failures.

### Common Request Body Fields

- `certkey`: (Mandatory string) Certification key
    
- `cert_userkey`: (Mandatory string) User key
    
- `cert_entitlement_valuekey`: (Mandatory string) Key to define user, role, and account. The following are the values:
    
    - User = "-4"
        
    - Role = "-2"
        
    - Account = "0"
        
    - Entitlement = "any value"
        
- `cert_accountkey`: (string) Account key (if applicable)
    
- `cert_rolekey`: (string) Role key (if applicable)
    
- `status`: (string) Approval status. The following are the values to be used:
    
    - Revoke / Action Cancelled = "0"
        
    - Approve and Change End Date = "2"
        
    - Reject = "3"
        
    - Terminate = "4"
        
    - Change End Date for Acc/Ent/Role = "5"
        
- `comments`: (string) Any comments related to the approval

This API facilitates certification consultations. It supports both individual and bulk actions and includes robust validation mechanisms to ensure data integrity and provide user-friendly error messages.

### Request Body

1. **eid** (Mandatory)
    
    1. **Description**: A unique identifier for the consultation request.
        
    2. **Data Type**: String
        
    3. **Example**: `"EorL7pMBeAuxnuyjVx1c"`
        
2. **comments** (Mandatory)
    
    1. **Description**: Comments or notes related to the consultation process.
        
    2. **Data Type**: String
        
    3. **Example**: `"Consult through api"`
        
3. **certkey** (Mandatory)
    
    1. **Description**: The key that identifies the specific certification task.
        
    2. **Data Type**: String or Integer
        
    3. **Example**: `"3048"`
        
4. **cert_userkey** (Mandatory)
    
    1. **Description**: The key associated with the user involved in the certification task.
        
    2. **Data Type**: String or Integer
        
    3. **Example**: `"29797"`
        
5. **cert_entitlement_valuekey** (Mandatory)
    
    1. **Description**: A key indicating the type of entitlement involved in the certification. Values can specify different types such as:
        
        - `0` for Account
            
        - `-2` for Role
            
        - `-4` for User
            
        - Any other value represents a specific entitlement key
            
    2. **Data Type**: String or Integer
        
    3. **Example**: `"0"`
        
6. Assignee: (Mandatory)
    
    1. **Description**: User which we are going to assign or consult.
        
    2. Example: `"3433"`
        
7. cert_accountkey: (Mandatory)
    
    1. **Description**: (string) Account key (if applicable).
        
    2. Example: `"3214"`

schema.example:
{
"eid":"EorL7pMBeAuxnuyjVx1c", // Mandatory
"comments":"Consult through api", // Mandatory
"certkey":"3048", // Mandatory
"cert_userkey":"29797", // Mandatory
"cert_entitlement_valuekey":"0", //Mandatory 0-Account, -2 Role,-4 User , Any other value is certification entitlement value key
"assignee":"4", //Mandatory
"cert_accountkey":"29319"
}

This API can be used to certify users employment status for user manager attestation.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Mandatory params: 

`verifications` - 

`employee` - Username to whom you want to certify

`verifier` - Indicates the ‘username’ of the approver/verifier
	
`action` - Specify the ‘Action’ you want to take for the respective Campaign. Possible values are ‘Works for me’, ‘Does not work for me’, ‘Terminated’, and ‘No response’
    
`id` - Indicates the attestation id for which you want to take action specified in the ‘Action’ parameter.  


Optional params:

`verifications` -

`comments` - Specify the comments you want to mention for taking the respective action

This API call can be used to get the details, status, and keys for accounts and entitlements within user manager attestation.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Mandatory params:  
`id` - attestation id

This API can be used to approve or reject accounts or entitlements for a user manager attestation.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`. 

Mandatory params: 

`attid` - attestation id,

`id` - same as attid,

`verifier` - Indicates the approver/verifier username verifying the attestation request,

`accounts` - 

  1.`accattkey` - Indicates the account id which you want to approve/reject
  
  2.`userattkey` - Indicates the user id which you want to approve
  
  3.`certified` - Select the action you want to perform. For approval, mention ‘Yes’ and for rejecting mention ‘No’
  
`entitlements` - 

  1.`accattkey` - Indicates the account id for which you want to approve/reject for the respective entitlement
  
  2.`userattkey` - Indicates the user id which you want to approve
  
  3.`certified` - Select the action you want to perform. For approval, mention ‘Yes’ and for rejecting mention ‘No’
  
  4.`entattkey` - Indicates the entitlement attribute key for which you want to approve/reject the respective entitlement
  

Either accounts or entitlements is mandatory.

Optional params:

`users` - 

  1.`userattkey` - Indicates the user id which you want to approve
  
  2.`certified` -  Specify the ‘Action’. Possible values are ‘Works for me’, ‘Does not work for me’, ‘Terminated’, and ‘No response’
  
`comments`

Mandatory params:

`comments`

post.summary: Approve Reject Campaign Account Entitlement Details
post.description:
This API is used to certify/revoke the user's access (account, entitlement) along with employment verification. When an approve or reject action is performed for a line item in a User Manager campaign, then only the latest comment sent through the API is retained in the comments field but all the comments (including actions) are stored in the audit trail/history.

From Release v23.8, this API now supports resetting of actions on roles within a certification.

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

Mandatory params:

`campaignid`

`certkey`

`verifier`

`accounts` -

1. `accattkey`
2. `userattkey`
3. `certified` (Can be Yes/No/Reset)
4. `comments`
    

`entitlements` -

1. `entattkey`
2. `accattkey`

The `Authorization` must have `Bearer` followed by `Token`.

`entitlements`- List of child entitlements. (You must provide either accounts/entitlements/roles)

`roles` - List of roles. (You must provide either accounts/entitlements/roles)

`bulkvalidation` (can be Y/N)

`certificationname` - Name of the certification.

put.description:
This API updates an existing risk specified in the url as `riskid`.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Optional Parameters:**

- `riskname`: Specify the name of the risk that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `description`: Specify the description of the risk that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `comments`: Specify any comment related to the risk that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `priority`: Specify the priority of the risk, such as `low`, `medium`, `high`, and `critical` to update an existing risk on the basis of the risk priority.
    
- `risktype`: Specify the type of the risk. Specify `SOD` for adding one or more functions and view the SOD violations in the SOD Violation workbench or `Crirtical Access`for adding single function for restriction or critical access to update an existing risk.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the risk. Specify `active`for active risks or `inactive`for inactive risks to update an existing risk.
    
- `ruleset`: Specify the appropriate ruleset associated with the risk that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `function1`: Specify the appropriate function that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `function2`: Specify the appropriate function that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `function3`: Specify the appropriate function that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `function4`: Specify the appropriate function that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `function5`: Specify the appropriate function that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `businessprocess`: Specify the appropriate business process name that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `analyticsname`: Specify the analytics configuration name that is required to be updated on the request body.

get.description:
This API shows the details of the risk specified in the URL as `riskid`.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

This API shows the list of risks available.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Optional Parameters:**

- `max`: Specify a `max value` to generate the maximum number of risk records.
    

> If you do not provide any `max` value, by default 100 is considered as `max` value. 
  

- `offset`: Specify an `offset` value to retrieve a subset of risk records starting with the offset value.
    

> If you do not provide any `offset`value, by default 0 is considered as `offset`value.

post.description:
This API creates a new function.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameters:**

- `functionName`: Specify the name of the risk that is required to be created on the request body.
    
- `rulesetname`: Specify the name of the appropriate ruleset associated with the function.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the risk. Specify `active`for active risks or `inactive`for inactive risks to update an existing risk.
    
- `functiontype`: Specify the type of the function. Specify `SAP` for functions related to SAP or `Non SAP` for functions related to other than SAP.
    

**Optional Parameters:**

- `description`: Specify the description of the function that is required to be created on the request body.
    
- `customproperty1, customproperty2, customproperty3, customproperty4, customproperty5`: Specify a custom property that can be added for the risk.
    
- `ownertype`: Specify the type of the owner that is required to be created on the request body.
    
- `owner`: Specify the name of the owner that is required to be created on the request body. Note: The `ownertype` and `owner` parameters are interlinked. Specifying one requires the other to be specified as well.

put.description:
This API updates an existing function specified in the URL as `functionkey`.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

#### Optional Parameters:

- `rulesetname`: Specify the name of the appropriate ruleset associated with the function.
    
- `functionName`: Specify the name of the risk that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the risk. Specify `active`active risks or `inactive`inactive risks to update an existing risk.
    
- `functiontype`: Specify the type of the function. Specify `SAP` for functions related to SAP or `Non SAP` for functions related to other than SAP.
    
- `description`: Specify the description of the function that is required to be updated on the request body.
    
- `customproperty1, customproperty2, customproperty3, customproperty4, customproperty5`: Specify a custom property that can be updated for the risk.
    
- `ownertype`: Specify the type of owner that must be updated on the request body.
    
- `owner`: Specify the owner's name, which must be updated on the request body.

get.description:
This API shows the entitlements under an existing function.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameter:**

- `$functionId`: Specify the unique identification value of the ruleset.
    

**Notes:**

- The condition position for the first entitlement must be 0 and should increment by 1 for each subsequent entitlement.
    
- The next and previous operators can be used to construct complex SQL queries.
    
- All the entitlements need to be added to the function to make any updates. Delta updates are not supported.
    
- Next and previous operators can be used to build complex sql queries.
    
- Operators can have values like ‘OR (‘.
    
- Fetch Entitlements in Function response can be used as a payload for Save Entitlements in Function.

This API shows the objects under an existing function.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Mandatory parameters:**

- `$functionId`: Specify the unique identification value of the ruleset.
    

**Optional parameters:**

- `max`: Specify a max value to generate the maximum number of ruleset records.
    

NOTE: If you do not provide any max value, by default 100 is considered as the max value.

- `offset`: Specify an offset value to retrieve a subset of ruleset records starting with the offset value.
    

NOTE: If you do not provide an offset value, 0 is considered the offset value by default.

post.description:
This API saves entitlements in the functions.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Notes:**

- The condition position for the first entitlement must be 0 and should increment by 1 for each subsequent entitlement.
    
- The next and previous operators can be used to construct complex SQL queries.
    
- All the entitlements need to be added to the function to make any updates. Delta updates are not supported.
    
- Next and previous operators can be used to build complex sql queries.
    
- Operators can have values like ‘OR (‘.

put.description:
This API updates an open violation status to in process for a violation.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameter:**

- `sodkey`: Specify the key of the SOD violation for which the violation status needs to be updated to in process.
    
- `startDate`: Specify the start date of the SOD violation for which the violation status needs to be updated to in process.
    
- `endDate`: Specify the end date of the SOD violation for which the violation status needs to be updated to in process.
    
- `comment`: Specify any comment for which the violation status needs to be updated to in process.

This API moves SOD specified in the `sodkey` to remediated state.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Mandatory Parameter:**

- `functionkey`: Specify the function key that is required to be created on the request body.

post.description:
The API updates SOD violations status in bulk.

The `Authorization` must have a `Bearer` followed by a `Token`.

**Optional Parameters:**

- `rulesetKey`: Specify this specific ruleset that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `endpointKey`: Specify this specific endpoint that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `sodStatuse`: Specify the status of SOD by choosing between `NEW`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `RISK_ACCEPTED`, `CLOSED`, `REMEDIATED`.
    
- `riskIds`: Specify the ID of the risk.
    
- `name`: Specify the name of the risk.
    
- `function1Name` to `function5Name`: Specify the function names associated with the risk.
    
- `riskpriority`: Specify the priority of the risk by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH`, `CRITICAL`.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty5`: Specify the custom properties associated with the risk.
    
- `riskType`: Specify the type of risk by choosing between `NONE`, `SOD`, `CRITICAL_ACTION`.
    
- `functionKeys`: Specify this specific function that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `name`: Specify the name of the function.
    
- `description`: Specify the description of the function.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the function by choosing between `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty5`: Specify the custom properties of the function.
    
- `entitlementValueKeys`: Specify this specific entitlement value that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `value`: Specify the value of the entitlement.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the entitlement by choosing between `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, `DECOMMISSION_ACTIVE`, `DECOMMISSION_INACTIVE` and `DELETED`.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty2`: Specify the custom properties of the entitlement.
    
- `soxCritical`: Specify the sox critical value of the entitlement by choosing between `NONE`, `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `VERY_HIGH`.
    
- `sysCritical`: Specify the sys critical value of the entitlement by choosing between `NONE`, `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `VERY_HIGH`.
    
- `risk`: Specify the risk value of the entitlement by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `CRITICAL`.
    
- `financial`: Specify the financial value of the entitlement by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `CRITICAL`.
    
- `privileged`: Specify the privileged value of the entitlement by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `CRITICAL`.
    
- `accountKeys`: Specify this specific account that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `name`: Specify the name of the account.
    
- `type`: Specify the type of the account.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the account.
    
- `securitysystemId`: Specify the security system ID of the account.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty2`: Specify the custom properties of the account.
    
- `userKeys`: Specify this specific user that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `userName`: Specify the name of the user.
    
- `firstName`: Specify the first name of the user.
    
- `lastName`: Specify the last name of the user.
    
- `costcenter`: Specify the cost center of the user.
    
- `employeeId`: Specify the employee ID of the user.
    
- `jobCode`: Specify the job code of the user.
    
- `jobDescription`: Specify the job description of the user.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty3`: Specify the custom properties of the user.
    
- `IN`: Specify `IN` value during a request.
    
- `notIn`: Specify `not In` value during a request.
    
- `startDate`: Specify `startDate` value during a request.
    
- `endDate`: Specify `endDate` value during a request.
    
- `comment`: Specify `comment` value during a request.

**Optional Parameter:**

- `rulesetKeys`: Specify this specific rulesets that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `endpointKeys`: Specify this specific endpoints that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `sodStatuses`: Specify the status of SOD by choosing between `OPEN`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `RISK_ACCEPTED`, `CLOSED`, `REMEDIATED`.
    
- `riskId`: Specify the ID of the risk.
    
- `name`: Specify the name of the risk.
    
- `function1Name` to `function5Name`: Specify the function names associated with the risk.
    
- `riskpriority`: Specify the priority of the risk by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH`, `CRITICAL`.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty5`: Specify the custom properties associated with the risk.
    
- `riskType`: Specify the type of risk by choosing between `NONE`, `SOD`, `CRITICAL_ACTION`.
    
- `functionKeys`: Specify this specific function that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `name`: Specify the name of the function.
    
- `description`: Specify the description of the function.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the function by choosing between `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty5`: Specify the custom properties of the function.
    
- `entitlementValueKeys`: Specify this specific entitlement value that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `value`: Specify the value of the entitlement.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the entitlement by choosing between `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`, `DECOMMISSION_ACTIVE`, `DECOMMISSION_INACTIVE` and `DELETED`.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty2`: Specify the custom properties of the entitlement.
    
- `soxCritical`: Specify the sox critical value of the entitlement by choosing between `NONE`, `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `VERY_HIGH`.
    
- `sysCritical`: Specify the sys critical value of the entitlement by choosing between `NONE`, `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `VERY_HIGH`.
    
- `risk`: Specify the risk value of the entitlement by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `CRITICAL`.
    
- `financial`: Specify the financial value of the entitlement by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `CRITICAL`.
    
- `privileged`: Specify the privileged value of the entitlement by choosing between `VERY_LOW`, `LOW`, `MEDIUM`, `HIGH` and `CRITICAL`.
    
- `accountKeys`: Specify this specific account that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `name`: Specify the name of the account.
    
- `type`: Specify the type of the account.
    
- `status`: Specify the status of the account.
    
- `securitysystemId`: Specify the security system ID of the account.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty2`: Specify the custom properties of the account.
    
- `userKeys`: Specify this specific user that has been identified to be applied during a request.
    
- `userName`: Specify the name of the user.
    
- `firstName`: Specify the first name of the user.
    
- `lastName`: Specify the last name of the user.
    
- `costcenter`: Specify the cost center of the user.
    
- `employeeId`: Specify the employee ID of the user.
    
- `jobCode`: Specify the job code of the user.
    
- `jobDescription`: Specify the job description of the user.
    
- `customProperty1` to `customProperty3`: Specify the custom properties of the user.
    
- `offset`: Specify an `offset` value to retrieve a subset of SOD violation records starting with the offset value. Note: If you do not provide any `offset`value, by default 0 is considered as `offset`value.
    
- `max`: Specify a `max` value to generate the maximum number of SOD violation records. Note: If you do not provide any `max` value, by default 15 is considered as `max` value.
    
- `field`: Specify a `field` value to sort the SOD violation list based on the selection. You can choose between `sodkey`, `riskId`, `riskName`, and `username`. Note: If you do not provide any `field` value, by default `sodkey` is considered as `field` value.
    
- `order`: Specify a `order` value to sort the SOD violation list based on the selection.
